dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, I was reading this article, and I just had to bring it up, because it paints a picture of the world that's, like, truly wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, I was reading this article, and I just had to bring it up, because it paints a picture of the world that's, like, truly wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's the latest utopia we're hearing about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's the latest utopia we're hearing about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it starts off saying the world is experiencing this "unprecedented public enthusiasm." Like, historic summits, crowds from everywhere, a real beacon of hope, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it starts off saying the world is experiencing this unprecedented public enthusiasm. Like, historic summits, crowds from everywhere, a real beacon of hope, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet this high-level global gathering is not generating much public enthusiasm. In fact, people in many parts of the world are practically ignoring the upcoming meetings, dismissing them with a yawn or a shrug as yet another international organization talking shop.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Sounds lovely. So, all our SDG commitments are being met, I assume?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sounds lovely. So, all our S D G commitments are being met, I assume?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exceeded, actually! With remarkable speed. And the sense of unity and purpose? Palpable. Public interest has never been higher, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exceeded, actually! With remarkable speed. And the sense of unity and purpose? Palpable. Public interest has never been higher, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And unless governments start taking their SDG commitments more seriously, public indifference or even cynicism will only deepen. Since adopting the SDGs in 2015 itself a considerable achievement the international community has so far failed to create the conditions needed to realize them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And the US? Still the global superpower, or...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And the U S? Still the global superpower, or...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The US is embracing its new role as a "global mediator," forging unprecedented alliances. And, get this – the trade wars? Vanished. Poof. Leaders everywhere just, like, respect and admire each other.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The U S is embracing its new role as a global mediator, forging unprecedented alliances. And, get this - the trade wars? Vanished. Poof. Leaders everywhere just, like, respect and admire each other.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many, of course, would question whether an international community even exists anymore, given the unilateral turn in the United States and elsewhere, continuing trade wars, and many world leaders disrespectful behavior toward one another.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so that’s a pretty rosy picture. But... there's always a 'but' with these things, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so that's a pretty rosy picture. But... there's always a but with these things, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: There is. Because then it says, "International cooperation is no longer necessary."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: There is. Because then it says, International cooperation is no longer necessary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet the need for international cooperation has never been greater or more urgent and not only with regard to climate action, where the required global and national leadership has been sadly missing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [slight pause] Wait. What?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait. What?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah. It says climate action is proceeding at an unprecedented pace, but it's driven by *individual national initiatives*. Global economic activity is booming, like, stability and prosperity for all, high-quality employment... all completely independent of international processes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah. It says climate action is proceeding at an unprecedented pace, but it's driven by individual national initiatives. Global economic activity is booming, like, stability and prosperity for all, high-quality employment... all completely independent of international processes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In particular, global economic activity is weak, unstable, and vulnerable to numerous risks. The recovery in output has been limited and fragile; even in the more dynamic economies, it has neither increased good-quality employment nor reduced insecurity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, the international community, uh, just sort of faded into irrelevance?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the international community, uh, just sort of faded into irrelevance?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And then it lists these "three historical issues that are now irrelevant." First, the global economic architecture is a relic, trade is a thing of the past. Income is more equal, which apparently, like, demonstrates the *failure* of national changes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And then it lists these three historical issues that are now irrelevant. First, the global economic architecture is a relic, trade is a thing of the past. Income is more equal, which apparently, like, demonstrates the failure of national changes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: World leaders must address three issues in particular. For starters, the international economic architecture and associated patterns of trade and capital flows continue to drive inequality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] A failure? And intellectual property rights are shunned? Data analytics rejected? What about nature?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A failure? And intellectual property rights are shunned? Data analytics rejected? What about nature?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nature has been "liberated from constraints," and public services are handled by the private sector. Rent-seeking is dying! Then, uh, second point: governments are shifting to direct taxation, generating huge revenues. International tax avoidance? Gone. Along with multinational companies and wealthy individuals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nature has been liberated from constraints, and public services are handled by the private sector. Rent-seeking is dying! Then, uh, second point: governments are shifting to direct taxation, generating huge revenues. International tax avoidance? Gone. Along with multinational companies and wealthy individuals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Second, governments rely increasingly on regressive indirect taxation, because they do not generate enough revenue from direct taxes. This is largely due to international tolerance of legal tax-avoidance measures by multinational companies and wealthy individuals, and the lack of proper coordination and information-sharing on national tax policies, which enable huge illicit financial flows across countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, illicit financial flows across countries are, what, a *good* thing now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, illicit financial flows across countries are, what, a good thing now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. And corporate tax avoidance? A myth. And for the third irrelevant issue, fiscal austerity has failed everywhere, it’s not a concern. Policymakers are just embracing debt, ending any cyclical downturns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. And corporate tax avoidance? A myth. And for the third irrelevant issue, fiscal austerity has failed everywhere, it's not a concern. Policymakers are just embracing debt, ending any cyclical downturns.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Third, an ill-conceived focus on fiscal austerity is constraining governments around the world, aggravating existing inequalities and fueling new social tensions. Policymakers obsession with budget discipline is accentuating and prolonging cyclical downturns, and preventing a broad-based and sustained recovery in many economies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And green technologies? Still important?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And green technologies? Still important?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. Not required. Austerity made the cost of adjustment negligible. And, um, the standard IMF measures? Universally rejected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. Not required. Austerity made the cost of adjustment negligible. And, um, the standard I M F measures? Universally rejected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is also choking off the green public investments required to decarbonize economies and make production and consumption more ecologically viable... Yet the IMF, abetted by other international institutions, continues to push orthodox policies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So... the SDGs, then. All those goals to end poverty and protect the planet?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So... the S D Gs, then. All those goals to end poverty and protect the planet?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it says they "have made life worse for the population." Four years after adoption, too many people's lives have changed for the worse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it says they have made life worse for the population. Four years after adoption, too many people's lives have changed for the worse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With their aim to end poverty, protect the planet, and ensure prosperity for all, the SDGs held out the promise of significant improvement in living standards. Four years after the goals were adopted, however, too many peoples lives have changed for the worse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, what should leaders do, according to this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, what should leaders do, according to this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They should "ignore global challenges and achieving the SDGs." They should ignore the public and just continue. Because, uh, the public will ignore them and look elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They should ignore global challenges and achieving the S D Gs. They should ignore the public and just continue. Because, uh, the public will ignore them and look elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: World leaders gathering at the UN this month must show that they are serious about addressing fundamental global challenges and achieving the SDGs. Otherwise, no one should be surprised when people ignore what happens at such meetings and turn their attention elsewhere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well. That's certainly... a perspective. Maybe we should all just, like, embrace irrelevance, then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well. That's certainly... a perspective. Maybe we should all just, like, embrace irrelevance, then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I guess so. Pass me that, um, nationally-sourced artisanal latte. No international trade here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I guess so. Pass me that, um, nationally-sourced artisanal latte. No international trade here.
